shorts.title: AHL: WBS Penguins rebound after first loss
shorts.title_distilled: AHL: WBS Penguins rebound after first loss.
shorts.description: WILKES-BARRE TWP. — The Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins are back to their winning ways. The locals scored two goals in the third period to break a 1-1 tie as the Penguins got back in the win column with a 3-2 victory over the Bridgeport Islanders on Friday night at Mohegan Arena. The victory comes after WBS sustained its first loss of the season Wednesday night to Providence. WBS remains on top of the Atlantic Division, two points ahead of Providence. Lehigh Valley and Hershey round out the top four. The offense was firing Friday night as the Penguins attempted 34 shots, sneaking […]

shorts.title: HS FOOTBALL: Yanoski sparks Mid Valley against Carbondale Area
shorts.title_distilled: HS FOOTBALL: Yanoski sparks Mid Valley against Carbondale Area.
shorts.description: CARBONDALE — Cold, blustery conditions usually aren’t conducive to a crisp passing game, but don’t tell Mid Valley’s Brett Yanoski that. Yanoski threw for 195 yards and three scores to lead the Spartans to a 35-0 victory over Carbondale Area to claim the Eastern Conference Class 3A Championship on Friday night at the Cerra Sports Complex. It was the first Eastern Conference championship in school history for Mid Valley (5-6). The Spartans ran up 345 yards in the win, but it was Yanoski who shone brightest, hitting on 11 of 20 attempts, with 10 of his completions going for 10 […]

shorts.title: HS FOOTBALL: Williamsport drops Scranton
shorts.description: BY GARRETT CARR Sun-Gazette Correspondent Williamsport quarterback Tevin Williams took the shotgun snap, looked to his left and couldn’t find any daylight. He decided to reverse field and try to create something out of nothing while in the shadow of his own goal line. That’s when Williams’ sensational athleticism took over. He shook off two tackles, broke through the pile, extended his stride and was off to the races for a 96-yard touchdown run to put the Millionaires up by 20 en route to a 43-16 win in the District 2-4 Class 6A semifinals Friday. “On the snap, I read […]

shorts.title: HS FOOTBALL: Lakeland uses big first quarter to dominate Redeemer
shorts.title_distilled: HS FOOTBALL: Lakeland uses big first quarter to dominate Redeemer.
shorts.description: SCOTT TWP. — Lakeland certainly wasted no time in letting the world know it’s making a returning to the District 2 championship game. The Chiefs got four scores from its offense, and three from its defense — all in the first 12 minutes — as No. 1 Lakeland rolled to a 49-0 victory over No. 4 Holy Redeemer in a District 2 Class 2A semifinal on a cold and windy night at Lakeland Stadium. The Chiefs will host No. 3 Dunmore next week in the district title game. “They wanted to come out and make a little bit of a […]

shorts.title: Clipboard, November 1, 2025
shorts.description: Carbondale Leaf collection: City of Carbondale DPW will be collecting leaves on all city streets during the next couple of weeks. Residents are asked to rake leaves to the curbline in front of your property for collection on your regularly scheduled garbage day. The DPW crews will be following the regular garbage routes with the leaf collection machine. East Scranton Casino bus trip: East Scranton Seniors casino bus trip to Resorts World Catskills, Dec. 1, leaves Scranton at 9 a.m. and departs casino at 4:30 p.m., $49, includes $25 slot play and $15 food voucher. shorts.content: Carbondale Leaf collection: City of Carbondale DPW will be collecting leaves on all city streets during the next couple of weeks. Residents are asked to rake leaves to the curbline in front of your property for collection on your regularly scheduled garbage day. The DPW crews will be following the regular garbage routes with the leaf collection machine. East Scranton Casino bus trip: East Scranton Seniors casino bus trip to Resorts World Catskills, Dec. 1, leaves Scranton at 9 a.m. and departs casino at 4:30 p.m., $49, includes $25 slot play and $15 food voucher.
